body.p: Below is the information for installing eXist externally. Also advise see your DB Clients and WebDav page (for connecting a GUI client or WebDav to the db.).

section.name: Installing customized eXist externally
section.p:
You will find a customized eXist at Astrogrid that has certain settings already set. Located here
Here are the instructions on how to run and install eXist:
Unzip it on a desired machine.
Typically good to set a environment variable EXIST_HOME to the location of the unzipped directory.
By default eXist will run on port 6080, if this is not desired you can change this in EXIST_HOME/tools/jetty/etc/jetty.xml change 6080 to desired port number.
Go to EXIST_HOME/bin and run startup.sh normally in the background so it is always going.
You may go to here for info on installing as a service and other details about eXist.
When you come to configuration section of the Registry you will need to change a JNDI property "xmldb.uri" to xmldb:exist://{machinehost}:6080/exist/xmlrpc

section.name: Installing eXist externally from eXist website
section.p:
You may for your own reasons want to install eXist straight from eXist website at http://exist.sourceforge.net. The download file is on the home page of eXist and see the quickstart guide for other info on installing such as on headless systems.
Once installed here are some things to be customized for the astrogrid registry:
in the bin/functions.d/eXist-settings.sh set set_exist_options() to have a -Xmx400M for 400mb memory. Only neede for Full Registries *For windows change the 128000k to 400M in the startup.bat. Memory is not much of an issue as much with its now streaming api service, but advised to increase.
Finally remember much like the above instructions to change your xmldb.uri JNDI property to your eXist and by default eXist runs on port 8080 this can be changed at EXIST_HOME/tools/jetty/etc/jetty.xml you can change the 8080 to 6080 for instance
